translated: At that time, the Blessed One's body was afflicted by a severe illness. The physician Jīvaka prepared thirty-two types of medicine mixed with ghee, and each day he gave thirty-two ounces of the compounded medicine.

translated: After a long time, he became exhausted and, in the hot season, he came to a hot sand that reached up to his knees. He was tired and tormented by thirst. He said to the animals,🔽“I am tormented by thirst. I will die here.

analyzed: gal te ma rnyed na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag dpal skyes zhes bya ba la brgya lon pa zhig gis rab tu 'byung ba'i yon tan 'di ltar tshad med do //

original: zhes thos nas 'di snyam du bdag ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu ma byung snyam bsam nas chung ma dang / bu dang / bran khol la nga ni /🔽rab @283a *// tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes thos nas 'di snyam du bdag ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu ma byung snyam bsam nas chung ma dang / bu dang / bran khol la nga ni / rab @283a *// tu 'byung ngo //
translated: Thinking, “Why don’t I go forth in the teachings of the Buddha?” he told his wife, children, and servants, “I am going forth.🔽”

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

analyzed: zhes thos pa dang / de dag dga' ste myur du 'gro ba'i rigs kyi /
translated: When they heard this, they were delighted and said, It is right to go quickly.

original: dus la bab bo //
analyzed: dus la bab bo //

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de khyim nas byung ste 'od ma'i tshal du bcom ldan 'das la rab tu 'byung bar gsol du song nas 'od ma'i tshal du phyin pa dang / dge slong rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po lha dang mi la phan pa'i don rgyas par mdzad pa ga la bzhugs zhes dris so //
translated: Then the householder left his house and went to the Bamboo Grove to request ordination from the Blessed One. When he arrived at the Bamboo Grove, he asked the monks, Where is the Blessed Buddha, the Blessed One of great compassion, who acts extensively for the benefit of gods and humans?

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /

analyzed: 'gro ba mang po la phan pa'i don du rgyu zhing gzhan du gshegs so; ;zhes smras so //

analyzed: slob pa dang / bsam @283b gtan dang / dge 'dun gyi las bya ba rnam pa gsum las nyams te mi nus so snyam bsam nas 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: khyod phyir song zhig /

analyzed: khyod ni / rgas 'khogs te dus las yol gyi /

analyzed: zhes bsgo'o // de nas mthar gyis 'od srung chen po dang / au pa li dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs te /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa chen po de dag kun gyi drung du song nas gsol ba btab pa las /

analyzed: bdag gis sngar btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu la gsol ba btab bo // 'o na ji skad zer /

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /

analyzed: khyod rgas 'khogs te dus las yol bas 'byung du mi rung ngo // zhes mchi'o // dge slong de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu lta bu mkhas pa dang / shes rab kyi mchog des kyang ma gnang na /

analyzed: bdag cag kyang de dang 'dra ste gnang ba med do //

analyzed: dper na / sman pa mkhas pa sman dpyad la mkhas pas nad pa brtags te sman dpyad mi byed par spong na /

analyzed: sman pa chung du gzhan dag kyang gso bar mi byed de /

analyzed: de la nges par 'chi ba'i mtshan ma yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro; ;sh'a ri'i bu blo dang ldan pas kyang ma gnang na /

analyzed: dge slong gzhan yang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: gnang ba med do // zhes bsgo'o // khyim bdag de dge slong rnams kyis rab tu 'byung bar @284a *//

original: ma gnang bas /
analyzed: ma gnang bas /

analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal nas phyir byung ste sgo'i them pa la 'dug nas skad chen po phyung ste smre sngags 'don cing dus so //

analyzed: bdag thog ma skyes nas nyes pa chen po ni ma byas na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag rab tu 'byung bar mi gnang /

analyzed: au pa li lta bu 'breg mkhan las byung ba dang / mi de lta bu phyag dar ba ngan skyug 'dor ba dang / sor phreng can lta bu mi grangs med pa bsad pa dang / aa si ka lta bu mi rgod ma rungs pa de dag la sogs pa yang rab tu byung na /
translated: The Buddha said, There were such people as Upali who became monks after being barbers, and such people as the sweeper who removed filth, and such people as Angulimala who killed countless people, and such people as Asvajit who were wild barbarians.🔽 What is wrong with you that I will not allow you to become a monk?

analyzed: khyim bdag dpal skyes la khyod ci'i phyir du zhes bka' stsal to //

original: zhes mchi bas /
analyzed: zhes mchi bas /

translated: Then the Blessed One, with his great compassion, like a father speaking kindly to a very dutiful son, encouraged the householder Śrīvardhana and said this:🔽Do not grieve,

original: ma byed cig /

analyzed: ngas khyod rab tu dbyung ngo // sh'a ri'i bus ni /

original: yul dang / grong khyer dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi sbyin pa byin pa ma yin /🔽sh'a ri'i bus ni /
analyzed: yul dang / grong khyer dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi sbyin pa byin pa ma yin /🔽sh'a ri'i bus ni /

translated: In the first incalculable eon, he served 88,000 buddhas; in the middle incalculable eon, he served 99,000 buddhas; and in the final incalculable eon, he served 100,000 buddhas. He went forth and completed the perfection of discipline.

original: sh'a ri'i bu ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ni /

translated: He has been lifted up by the six perfections, has put on the armor of patience, and sits on the vajra seat at the foot of the Bodhi tree. Having subdued the hosts of Mara, he has attained perfect Buddhahood. There is no one equal to me.🔽 Therefore, come after me!

original: rab tu dbyung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dbyung ngo //
translated: I will give you the going forth.

translated: Thus, through various skillful means, the Blessed One dispelled all their sorrow and they generated the joyful mind. They followed the Buddha into the monastery.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis moo gal ya na chen po la khyim bdag 'di rab tu phyung zhig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis moo gal ya na chen po la khyim bdag 'di rab tu phyung zhig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Maudgalyayana the Great, Ordain this householder!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sems can ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sems can ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: las gang dang mthun pa des 'dul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gang dang mthun pa des 'dul bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because sentient beings are to be disciplined by whatever is suitable for them.

original: gang sangs rgyas dang las mthun pa la ni /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas dang las mthun pa la ni /
translated: Those who are suitable to be tamed by the Buddha

original: gzhan gyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cannot be tamed by others.

original: gang gzhan dang las mthun pa de la yang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gzhan dang las mthun pa de la yang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are suitable to be tamed by others cannot be tamed by the Buddha.

original: gang zhig sh'a ri'i bu dang las mthun pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig sh'a ri'i bu dang las mthun pa ni /
translated: Those who are suitable to be tamed by Śāriputra

original: moo gal dang / 'od srung dang / ma 'gags pa dang / na bun la sogs pa nye @286a *//
analyzed: moo gal dang / 'od srung dang / ma 'gags pa dang / na bun la sogs pa nye @286a *//
translated: cannot be tamed by Maudgalyāyana, Kāśyapa, Aniruddha, Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya, or any of the other close disciples.

original: gnas gzhan thams cad kyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas gzhan thams cad kyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are suitable to be tamed by others cannot be tamed by them.

original: de bzhin du gang dang gang las mthun pa de la gzhan gyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang gang las mthun pa de la gzhan gyis 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, those who are suitable to be tamed by one cannot be tamed by another.

original: de'i tshe moo ga la ya nas kyang khyim bdag 'di rgas 'khogs te kha ton slob pa dang / bsam gtan dang / dge 'dun gyi las byed mi nus te las bya ba gsum las nyams so snyam bsams kyang chos kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung zhig ces bka' stsal pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe moo ga la ya nas kyang khyim bdag 'di rgas 'khogs te kha ton slob pa dang / bsam gtan dang / dge 'dun gyi las byed mi nus te las bya ba gsum las nyams so snyam bsams kyang chos kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung zhig ces bka' stsal pas /
translated: At that time Maudgalyāyana thought, “This householder is old and decrepit. He cannot study recitations, practice concentration, or do the work of the saṅgha. He has fallen from the three activities.” Although he thought this, the Dharma King, the Blessed One, said, “Ordain him.”

original: tshul gyis bzlog tu mi rung ngo snyam bsams nas rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs so //
analyzed: tshul gyis bzlog tu mi rung ngo snyam bsams nas rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs so //
translated: He thought, It is not right to turn him away by these means. So he gave him ordination and the full monastic vows.

original: mi 'dis tshe rabs snga ma la thar par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang bskyed /
analyzed: mi 'dis tshe rabs snga ma la thar par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang bskyed /
translated: This man had created the causes for liberation in his previous lives,

original: chos kyi lcags kyus zin pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi lcags kyus zin pa ni /
translated: and he was caught by the hook of the Dharma.🔽Just as when a fish is caught on a hook, there is no doubt that it will come out,

original: ji ltar nya mchil pa la thogs na gdon mi za bar phyir 'byung ba ltar thar pa'i rgyu yang bskyed /
analyzed: ji ltar nya mchil pa la thogs na gdon mi za bar phyir 'byung ba ltar thar pa'i rgyu yang bskyed /
translated: he created the causes for liberation.

original: dge ba'i tshogs kyang bsags pas nyin mtshan du brtson 'grus bskyed de klog pa dang 'don pa la goms shing /
analyzed: dge ba'i tshogs kyang bsags pas nyin mtshan du brtson 'grus bskyed de klog pa dang 'don pa la goms shing /
translated: He also accumulated the provisions of virtue. Day and night he exerted himself in reading and reciting.

original: mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa rgyas par khong du chud cing rtogs par gyur na /🔽rgas 'khogs pas tshul bzhin du rim gro dang / bsti stang dang / bsu skyel dang / bla ma la gsong bor smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa rgyas par khong du chud cing rtogs par gyur na / rgas 'khogs pas tshul bzhin du rim gro dang / bsti stang dang / bsu skyel dang / bla ma la gsong bor smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: He became familiar with and understood the extensive sutras, the Vinaya, and the Abhidharma.🔽But because he was old and decrepit, he was unable to properly serve and respect his gurus, to greet them, to bow down to them,

original: mi nus so //
analyzed: mi nus so //
translated: and to speak to them respectfully.

original: de la dge slong gzhon nu sngar rab tu byung ba gral @286b mtho ba dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la dge slong gzhon nu sngar rab tu byung ba gral @286b mtho ba dag 'di skad du /
translated: The younger monks, who had been ordained earlier and were seated in the higher rows, said,

original: dge slong rgan po 'di 'don pa dang / klog pa dang / slob pa la snyems te bdag cag la bkur sti yang mi byed do snyam nas rtag tu 'tsho bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong rgan po 'di 'don pa dang / klog pa dang / slob pa la snyems te bdag cag la bkur sti yang mi byed do snyam nas rtag tu 'tsho bar gyur to //
translated: This old monk is arrogant because he recites, reads, and studies, and so does not show us respect. And so they always harassed him.

original: de nas dge slong rgan po des 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong rgan po des 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: Then the old monk thought,

original: bdag khyim na 'dug pa'i tshe na chung ma dang bus gtses /
analyzed: bdag khyim na 'dug pa'i tshe na chung ma dang bus gtses /
translated: When I was at home, my wife and children bothered me.

original: da rab tu byung nas 'di lta bu'i bag med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: da rab tu byung nas 'di lta bu'i bag med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Now that I have gone forth, I have become so careless.

original: da yang dge slong gzhon nu 'di dag gis gtse na /
analyzed: da yang dge slong gzhon nu 'di dag gis gtse na /
translated: Now these young monks are bothering me.

original: sngon nyes pa ci zhig byas na 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pas bdag da shi yang rung snyam bsams nas tshal de'i 'gram na chu chen po zhig 'bab pa'i 'gram du song nas chos gos phud de shing gi yal ga la bkal nas pus mo sa
analyzed: sngon nyes pa ci zhig byas na 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pas bdag da shi yang rung snyam bsams nas tshal de'i 'gram na chu chen po zhig 'bab pa'i 'gram du song nas chos gos phud de shing gi yal ga la bkal nas pus mo sa
translated: What misdeeds did I commit in the past that I am tormented by such suffering? It would be better for me to die now. With this thought, he went to the bank of a great river that flowed by the edge of the forest.

original: la btsugs te mchi ma blags nas 'di snyam du yi dam bcas so //
analyzed: la btsugs te mchi ma blags nas 'di snyam du yi dam bcas so //
translated: He planted his knees on the ground, shed tears, and made this vow:

original: bdag ni / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yongs su spong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yongs su spong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “I do not abandon the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: lus 'di 'ba' zhig gtong ngo //
analyzed: lus 'di 'ba' zhig gtong ngo //
translated: I am only giving up this body.

original: bdag gis sbyin pa bgyis pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / mdo sde kha ton byas pa'i bsod nams kyis bdag gi lus 'di dang bral nas btsan zhing phyug la longs spyod dang ldan pa 'khor 'dum pa'i rigs su skyes te bdag dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i bgegs mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin pa bgyis pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / mdo sde kha ton byas pa'i bsod nams kyis bdag gi lus 'di dang bral nas btsan zhing phyug la longs spyod dang ldan pa 'khor 'dum pa'i rigs su skyes te bdag dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i bgegs mi byed pa dang /
translated: By the merit of my generosity, my observance of moral precepts, my practice of diligence, and my recitation of the sūtras, may I, after separating from this body, be born in a powerful, wealthy, and prosperous family, and may I not be an obstacle to engaging in virtuous dharmas.

original: rtag tu dkon mchog gsum dang phrad pa dang / rab @287a *//
analyzed: rtag tu dkon mchog gsum dang phrad pa dang / rab @287a *//
translated: May I always encounter the Three Jewels,

original: tu 'byung zhing chos la nan tan byed pa dang / slob dpon mkhas pa dang phrad de mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ston par shog cig /
analyzed: tu 'byung zhing chos la nan tan byed pa dang / slob dpon mkhas pa dang phrad de mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ston par shog cig /
translated: go forth, practice the Dharma, meet with wise teachers, and may they teach me nirvāṇa.”

original: ces dam bcas nas gang na chu drag po 'bab cing zab pa /
analyzed: ces dam bcas nas gang na chu drag po 'bab cing zab pa /
translated: Having made this vow, he went to a place where the water was strong, deep,

original: klong 'khyil ba dang dpa' rgod par mchod par gzas so //
analyzed: klong 'khyil ba dang dpa' rgod par mchod par gzas so //
translated: and swirling, and he resolved to make an offering.

original: de'i tshe moo gal gyi bus lha'i mig gis bdag gi nye gnas rgan po de da ltar ci zhig byed snyam bltas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe moo gal gyi bus lha'i mig gis bdag gi nye gnas rgan po de da ltar ci zhig byed snyam bltas na /
translated: At that time Maudgalyāyana, with his divine eye, thought, “What is my old student doing now?”🔽He saw that his student was about to jump into the water. Without going into the water, he used his magical power to pull him out and put him on the bank. He asked, “Son of the Dharma, what are you doing?”

original: bdag gi nye gnas de chu la mchong bar mthong nas chur ma phyin par rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus blangs nas chu'i 'gram du bzhag ste chos kyi sras khyod ci zhig byed ces dris pa dang / rgan po de ngo tsha zhing skyengs nas ji skad du lan gdab bsams nas gal te bdag gis brdzun byas te slob dpon bslus na /
analyzed: bdag gi nye gnas de chu la mchong bar mthong nas chur ma phyin par rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus blangs nas chu'i 'gram du bzhag ste chos kyi sras khyod ci zhig byed ces dris pa dang / rgan po de ngo tsha zhing skyengs nas ji skad du lan gdab bsams nas gal te bdag gis brdzun byas te slob dpon bslus na /
translated: The old man was ashamed and embarrassed. He thought, “If I lie and deceive my teacher,

original: slob dpon bslus pas skye ba thams cad du lce'i dbang po med pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon bslus pas skye ba thams cad du lce'i dbang po med pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: because I have deceived my teacher, in all my lives I will have the misfortune of being without a tongue.”

original: ci ste bdag gis brdzun du smras na yang slob dpon la mngon par shes pa mnga' bas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste bdag gis brdzun du smras na yang slob dpon la mngon par shes pa mnga' bas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were to lie, the master would know, because he has supernormal knowledge.

original: gang 'jig rten mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan la rang bzhin gyi drang zhing g-yo sgyu med na /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan la rang bzhin gyi drang zhing g-yo sgyu med na /
translated: If someone is wise in the world, honest by nature, and without deceit,

original: lha rnams kyis bkur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis bkur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be respected by the gods.

original: mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa g-yo sgyu zhig yod na yang gzhan gyi slob dpon du mi rung ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa g-yo sgyu zhig yod na yang gzhan gyi slob dpon du mi rung ste /
translated: If someone is wise and deceitful, he is not suitable as a teacher for others.

original: mi bkur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bkur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be respected.

original: gal te shes pa med kyang g-yo sgyu yang med de drang @287b na; gzhan gyi don byed mi nus kyang bdag gi don byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa med kyang g-yo sgyu yang med de drang @287b na; gzhan gyi don byed mi nus kyang bdag gi don byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone is honest and without deceit, even if he is not wise, he is able to accomplish his own aims, even if he is not able to accomplish the aims of others.

original: gal te glen pa gti mug can yang yin la g-yo sgyu yod na /
analyzed: gal te glen pa gti mug can yang yin la g-yo sgyu yod na /
translated: If someone is stupid, ignorant, and deceitful,

original: thams cad kyi dgra ma rung ba yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dgra ma rung ba yin te /
translated: he is a bad enemy for everyone.

original: ci smras kyang 'di ni /🔽brdzun du smra ba ste /
analyzed: ci smras kyang 'di ni / brdzun du smra ba ste /
translated: Whatever he says🔽is a lie.

original: slu ba yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slu ba yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //
translated: He is a deceiver.

original: gal te tshig bden pa zhig smras na yang kun gyis yid mi ches te /
analyzed: gal te tshig bden pa zhig smras na yang kun gyis yid mi ches te /
translated: If I tell the truth, no one will believe me.

original: de bas na bdag gis slob dpon la brdzun du smras te bslus na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis slob dpon la brdzun du smras te bslus na /
translated: Therefore, I will deceive the master by telling a lie.

original: mi rigs mi bsha'i /
analyzed: mi rigs mi bsha'i /
translated: It is not right to tell a lie.

original: gang bden pa smra'o snyam bsams nas slob dpon la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gang bden pa smra'o snyam bsams nas slob dpon la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: I will tell the truth.”

original: bdag khyim gyis skyo ste khyim ma yin par rab tu byung nas dben pa zhi bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: bdag khyim gyis skyo ste khyim ma yin par rab tu byung nas dben pa zhi bar 'tshal na /
translated: “I am weary of the household life and have gone forth from home into homelessness.

original: da yang mi bde bar gyur nas bdag 'gum snyam mo //
analyzed: da yang mi bde bar gyur nas bdag 'gum snyam mo //
translated: Now, I am unhappy and think I will die.”

original: moo gal gyi bus de skad ces smras pa thos nas 'di la ni /
analyzed: moo gal gyi bus de skad ces smras pa thos nas 'di la ni /
translated: When Maudgalyāyana heard this, he thought,

original: skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'jig pa zhig gis ma bsdigs na /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'jig pa zhig gis ma bsdigs na /
translated: “If I do not frighten her with the terrors of birth and death,🔽her going forth will be meaningless.”

original: rab tu byung ba'i don med par 'gyur ro snyam bsams nas de la nga'i chos gos kyi mtha' ma 'di la dam du zungs la ma btang zhig ces smras nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i don med par 'gyur ro snyam bsams nas de la nga'i chos gos kyi mtha' ma 'di la dam du zungs la ma btang zhig ces smras nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags pa ni /
translated: He said to her, “Hold on tightly to the edge of my robe and do not let go.”

original: rlung gis sbur ma bus pa ltar rdzu 'phrul gyis lag na spu nyag ma gcig tsam khyer ba dang 'dra bar yid bzhin du phyin to; ;gzhan yang bya khras bye'u phrug khyer ba ltar moo gal gyi bu rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'phags nas skyes bus lag🔽ngar bskum pa las brkyang ba tsam gyi rgya mtsho'i 'gram @288a *//
analyzed: rlung gis sbur ma bus pa ltar rdzu 'phrul gyis lag na spu nyag ma gcig tsam khyer ba dang 'dra bar yid bzhin du phyin to; ;gzhan yang bya khras bye'u phrug khyer ba ltar moo gal gyi bu rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'phags nas skyes bus lag ngar bskum pa las brkyang ba tsam gyi rgya mtsho'i 'gram @288a *//
translated: Moreover, like a hawk carrying off a little bird, Maudgalyāyana rose into the sky with his magical power and in the time it takes a strong man to bend and extend his arm,

original: du phyin te //
analyzed: du phyin te //
translated: he arrived on the shore of the ocean.

original: rgya mtsho'i 'gram de na bud med tshe 'phos ma thag pa'i ro shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i 'gram de na bud med tshe 'phos ma thag pa'i ro shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: On the shore of the ocean there was the corpse of a woman who had just died, very beautiful,

original: bzang ba / mnga' byad legs pa /
analyzed: bzang ba / mnga' byad legs pa /
translated: good, with an excellent figure,

original: mtshan dang ldan pa la sbrul zhig kha'i nang du zhugs nas sna'i nang nas byung /
analyzed: mtshan dang ldan pa la sbrul zhig kha'i nang du zhugs nas sna'i nang nas byung /
translated: and endowed with auspicious marks. A snake entered her mouth and came out her nose,

original: mig gi nang nas zhugs nas rna ba'i nang du byur ba moo gal gyi bus rab tu brtags so //
analyzed: mig gi nang nas zhugs nas rna ba'i nang du byur ba moo gal gyi bus rab tu brtags so //
translated: entered her eyes and came out her ears. Maudgalyāyana examined her thoroughly.

original: de nas dge slong dpal skyes kyis bud med 'di lta bu mtshan dang ldan pa su yin zhes zhus na /
analyzed: de nas dge slong dpal skyes kyis bud med 'di lta bu mtshan dang ldan pa su yin zhes zhus na /
translated: Then the monk Śrīgupta asked, Who is this woman with such auspicious marks?

original: nam dus la bab na bstan to //
analyzed: nam dus la bab na bstan to //
translated: “I will teach you when the time comes.”

original: zhes smras te yang song ba dang / bud med cig zangs po che zhig btsugs te zangs kyi nang du chu blugs nas 'og tu me po che bus te chu khol ba dang gos phud nas nang du zhugs te de ma thag tu skra dang spu kun byi nas sha yang tshos te rus pa yang
analyzed: zhes smras te yang song ba dang / bud med cig zangs po che zhig btsugs te zangs kyi nang du chu blugs nas 'og tu me po che bus te chu khol ba dang gos phud nas nang du zhugs te de ma thag tu skra dang spu kun byi nas sha yang tshos te rus pa yang
translated: Again they went on their way, and they saw a woman who had set up a large copper pot, filled it with water, and lit a great fire underneath. As the water boiled, she took off her clothes and got into the pot. Immediately her hair and body hair were singed, her flesh was cooked, and her bones

original: bye nas chu lus pas rus pa rnams phyir byung ngo //
analyzed: bye nas chu lus pas rus pa rnams phyir byung ngo //
translated: were separated. The water carried the bones away, and they came out again.

original: rus pa de dag rlung gis bus pas de ma thag tu mi zhig tu gyur nas zangs kyi nang nas sha phyung ste za ba zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: rus pa de dag rlung gis bus pas de ma thag tu mi zhig tu gyur nas zangs kyi nang nas sha phyung ste za ba zhig mthong ngo //
translated: The bones were blown by the wind and immediately turned into a man. He took the flesh out of the copper pot and ate it.

original: dge slong dpal skyes skrag ste ba spu yang langs nas slob dpon la sha za ba 'di su yin zhes zhus na /
analyzed: dge slong dpal skyes skrag ste ba spu yang langs nas slob dpon la sha za ba 'di su yin zhes zhus na /
translated: The monk Śrīgupta was frightened and his hair stood on end. He asked the master, “Who is this flesh-eater?”

original: moo gal gyi bus dus la bab na bstan to //
analyzed: moo gal gyi bus dus la bab na bstan to //
translated: Maudgalyāyana said, “I will teach you when the time comes.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / yang song song ba las shing chen po zhig lo ma dang yal ga'i bar du khab kyi rtse mo tsam gzugs pa'i sa stong tsam yang med par srin bu mang pos za ba la skad chen por du zhing 'bod pa'i sgra kun tu @288b grags pa sems can
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / yang song song ba las shing chen po zhig lo ma dang yal ga'i bar du khab kyi rtse mo tsam gzugs pa'i sa stong tsam yang med par srin bu mang pos za ba la skad chen por du zhing 'bod pa'i sgra kun tu @288b grags pa sems can
translated: He said, What is this sound?🔽 They went on and heard a sound like the voice of a hell-being, a great cry of Woe! coming from a great tree, which was being eaten by many insects, with no space the size of the tip of a needle free from leaves and branches.

original: dmyal ba'i sgra 'dra ba zhig thos nas 'di lta bu'i sgra mi snyan pa su'i lags zhes zhus na /🔽moo gal gyi bus dus la bab na bstan to //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i sgra 'dra ba zhig thos nas 'di lta bu'i sgra mi snyan pa su'i lags zhes zhus na / moo gal gyi bus dus la bab na bstan to //
translated: He asked, Whose is this unpleasant sound?

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Maudgalyāyana said, When the time comes, I will show you.

original: de nas yang mi'i lus la gcan gzan gyi mgo can du 'dug pa'i yi dvags mang pos mi zhig la 'khor bar bskor te lag na mda' gzhu thogs shing mda' la me 'bar bzhin du kun gyis mi de la mda' 'phangs nas gcig tu 'bar bar mthong ste
analyzed: de nas yang mi'i lus la gcan gzan gyi mgo can du 'dug pa'i yi dvags mang pos mi zhig la 'khor bar bskor te lag na mda' gzhu thogs shing mda' la me 'bar bzhin du kun gyis mi de la mda' 'phangs nas gcig tu 'bar bar mthong ste
translated: Then they saw many ghosts with human bodies and animal heads surrounding a man. They had bows and arrows in their hands, and the arrows were on fire. All of them shot arrows at the man, and he became a single mass of flames.

original: / 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa myong ba yang 'bros pa'i gnas med pa 'di su lags zhes zhus na; slob dpon gyis re zhig sdod cig /
analyzed: / 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa myong ba yang 'bros pa'i gnas med pa 'di su lags zhes zhus na; slob dpon gyis re zhig sdod cig /
translated: The master replied, “Wait a while.

original: dus la bab na bstan to //
analyzed: dus la bab na bstan to //
translated: When the time is right, I will teach you.”

original: zhes bsgo'o / de nas yang song song ba las ring zhig lon pa dang / ri chen po zhig gi drung na ral gri dang mtshon rnon po so gyen du gtams te btsugs pa la mi zhig ri'i rtse mo nas thur du rgyugs te ral gri dang /
analyzed: zhes bsgo'o / de nas yang song song ba las ring zhig lon pa dang / ri chen po zhig gi drung na ral gri dang mtshon rnon po so gyen du gtams te btsugs pa la mi zhig ri'i rtse mo nas thur du rgyugs te ral gri dang /
translated: They continued on their way, and after a long time they saw in front of a great mountain a man running down from the peak of the mountain, his body pierced and torn by swords and sharp weapons that were planted in the ground, their points facing upward.

original: mtshon gyis zug cing ral nas phyir yang ral gri dang mtshon sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: mtshon gyis zug cing ral nas phyir yang ral gri dang mtshon sa la btsugs te /
translated: The man ran back up the mountain, and again the swords and weapons pierced and tore his body.

original: de bzhin du mi dal bar rgyug pa mthong nas 'di lta bu su lags zhes zhus na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dal bar rgyug pa mthong nas 'di lta bu su lags zhes zhus na /
translated: “Who is this?” they asked.

original: slob dpon gyis dus la bab na bstan to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dus la bab na bstan to //
translated: The master replied, “When the time is right, I will teach you.”

original: zhes bsgo'o // de nas yang song song ba las rus pa'i ri chen po mtho khyad dpag tshad bdun brgya pa /
analyzed: zhes bsgo'o // de nas yang song song ba las rus pa'i ri chen po mtho khyad dpag tshad bdun brgya pa /
translated: They continued on their way, and after a long time they saw a great mountain of bones, seven hundred leagues high,

original: nyi ma yang sgrib cing rgya mtsho yang grib mas mun par gyur pa de la moo gal 'dzegs te rtsib rus @289a *//🔽gcig gi steng nas phan tshun du 'gro ba'i phyi bzhin du bdag kyang song ba mthong nas 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: nyi ma yang sgrib cing rgya mtsho yang grib mas mun par gyur pa de la moo gal 'dzegs te rtsib rus @289a *// gcig gi steng nas phan tshun du 'gro ba'i phyi bzhin du bdag kyang song ba mthong nas 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: The sun was obscured, and the ocean was darkened by the shadow. Maudgalyāyana climbed up and walked back and forth on one of the ribs.🔽I followed him.🔽I thought, ‘I am separated from my teacher, and I want to ask about the things I saw before.’

original: bdag ni / slob dpon dang de'u re bral gyi; sngar mthong ba'i dngos po de dag zhu'o snyam bsams nas slob dpon la bdag gis sngar mthong ba'i dngos po de dag bstan du gsol zhes zhus pa dang / moo gal gyis kyang da dus la bab kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / slob dpon dang de'u re bral gyi; sngar mthong ba'i dngos po de dag zhu'o snyam bsams nas slob dpon la bdag gis sngar mthong ba'i dngos po de dag bstan du gsol zhes zhus pa dang / moo gal gyis kyang da dus la bab kyi /
translated: I asked the teacher, ‘Please show me the things I saw before.’ Maudgalyāyana said, ‘Now the time has come.

original: khyod la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod la bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will show them to you.

original: sngar mthong ba'i bud med de shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i bud med de shes par 'dod na /
translated: If you want to know the woman you saw before,

original: de ni / rgyal po'i khab na sar phag chen po zhes bya ba'i chung ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni / rgyal po'i khab na sar phag chen po zhes bya ba'i chung ma yin te /
translated: she is the wife of a great swineherd in Rājagṛha.

original: byad bzhin bzang bas khyim thab kyang lhag par byams so //
analyzed: byad bzhin bzang bas khyim thab kyang lhag par byams so //
translated: Because her face is beautiful, her husband loves her especially.

original: de'i tshe na sar phag de rgya mtshor 'jug pa las chung ma gtong ma phod nas chung ma yang khrid de tshong pa lnga brgya tsam dang rgya mtshor zhugs nas de'i chung ma rtag tu shing gsum mgo bsdus te mdung khyim ltar byas nas de la me long
analyzed: de'i tshe na sar phag de rgya mtshor 'jug pa las chung ma gtong ma phod nas chung ma yang khrid de tshong pa lnga brgya tsam dang rgya mtshor zhugs nas de'i chung ma rtag tu shing gsum mgo bsdus te mdung khyim ltar byas nas de la me long
translated: At that time, the merchant could not bear to leave his wife behind when he went to sea, so he took her with him. They set out on the ocean with about five hundred merchants. The merchant’s wife always put three sticks together, like a spear shaft, and placed a mirror on top of them.

original: bzhag ste me long las bltas na /
analyzed: bzhag ste me long las bltas na /
translated: She looked at herself in the mirror.

original: bdag gi byad bzhin bzang bar mthong nas shin tu chags pa skyes so //
analyzed: bdag gi byad bzhin bzang bar mthong nas shin tu chags pa skyes so //
translated: Seeing her own beautiful face, she became very attached.

original: de'i tshe na rgya mtsho'i nang nas rus sbal chen po zhig gis gru brdzis nas gru zhig ste tshong pa lnga brgya tsam thams cad tshe'i dus byas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgya mtsho'i nang nas rus sbal chen po zhig gis gru brdzis nas gru zhig ste tshong pa lnga brgya tsam thams cad tshe'i dus byas so //
translated: At that time, a great turtle struck the ship, and the ship was destroyed. All five hundred merchants died.

original: rgya mtsho'i chos nyid kyis ro zhag tu lon par mi gnas pas chus phul te rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chos nyid kyis ro zhag tu lon par mi gnas pas chus phul te rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin to //
translated: By the nature of the ocean, corpses do not remain for a day. They are carried off by the water and come to the shore of the ocean.

original: sems can @289b dag ni; tshe'i dus byed pa na ci la chags pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can @289b dag ni; tshe'i dus byed pa na ci la chags pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When sentient beings die, they are reborn wherever they are attached.

original: 'o na su zhig sems can dmyal bar skye bar dga' na /
analyzed: 'o na su zhig sems can dmyal bar skye bar dga' na /
translated: Who would like to be born in the hells?

original: sems can dmyal bar mang du skyes par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar mang du skyes par 'gyur /
translated: Those who are born in the hells are many indeed.

original: smras pa; sems can gang dkon mchog gsum gyi nor brkus sam /
analyzed: smras pa; sems can gang dkon mchog gsum gyi nor brkus sam /
translated: Those who steal the property of the Three Jewels,

original: pha ma'i longs spyod brkus sam /
analyzed: pha ma'i longs spyod brkus sam /
translated: or the property of their parents,

original: mi'i srog bcod pa'i kha na ma tho ba chen po byas na /
analyzed: mi'i srog bcod pa'i kha na ma tho ba chen po byas na /
translated: or who commit the great crime of killing a human being,

original: shin tu 'bar ba'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu 'bar ba'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: will fall into the great hell of extreme heat.

original: mi de rlung ngam grang nad kyis gzir bas yid la me 'dod par bsam mo //
analyzed: mi de rlung ngam grang nad kyis gzir bas yid la me 'dod par bsam mo //
translated: If a person is tormented by wind or cold, he should think of fire.

original: me'i nang du 'gro bar bsam ma thag tu tshe'i dus byas nas shin tu 'bar ba'i sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: me'i nang du 'gro bar bsam ma thag tu tshe'i dus byas nas shin tu 'bar ba'i sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o //
translated: As soon as he thinks of entering the fire, his life will end and he will go to the great hell of extreme heat.

original: de la gang sangs rgyas la phul ba'i mar me'am /
analyzed: de la gang sangs rgyas la phul ba'i mar me'am /
translated: Those who steal the butter-lamps offered to the Buddha,

original: rin po che brkus sam /🔽dge 'dun gyi  ma'am /
analyzed: rin po che brkus sam / dge 'dun gyi  ma'am /
translated: or the jewels,

original: shing brkus sam /
analyzed: shing brkus sam /
translated: or the wood of the Sangha,

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas khang bshig gam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas khang bshig gam /
translated: or who destroy the dwelling-places of the Sangha,

original: chos 'chad pa'i 'dun khang bshig gam /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i 'dun khang bshig gam /
translated: or who destroy the assembly-halls where the Dharma is taught,🔽or who steal the property of the Sangha,

original: dgun grang ba'i dus su pha rol po'i gos 'phrag  ma /🔽mthu yod pas lhags pa'i nang du bran mo'am /
analyzed: dgun grang ba'i dus su pha rol po'i gos 'phrag  ma / mthu yod pas lhags pa'i nang du bran mo'am /
translated: In the cold season of winter, they steal the clothes from the backs of others.🔽With their magical powers, they steal the clothes of servants

original: bran mo'am / mi gzhan gyi gos 'phrog ste chu blugs sam /
analyzed: bran mo'am / mi gzhan gyi gos 'phrog ste chu blugs sam /
translated: or other people, and pour water on them.

original: gzhan gyi gos bshus shing 'phrog na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gos bshus shing 'phrog na /
translated: If they steal and take the clothes of others,

original: kha na ma tho ba'i las kyi sdig pa 'dis chab dron gyi sems can dmyal bar ltung ste /🔽mi de tsha ba'i nad kyis gzir bas rtag tu bsil zhing grang @290a *//
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i las kyi sdig pa 'dis chab dron gyi sems can dmyal bar ltung ste / mi de tsha ba'i nad kyis gzir bas rtag tu bsil zhing grang @290a *//
translated: because of the negative karma of this reprehensible action, they will fall into the hot hells.🔽Because these people are tormented by the illness of heat, they constantly think of cool and cold places.

original: ba'i gnas sems te grang bar 'dod pas dus byas ma thag tu sems can dmyal ba der skyes te /
analyzed: ba'i gnas sems te grang bar 'dod pas dus byas ma thag tu sems can dmyal ba der skyes te /
translated: As soon as they die, they are reborn in the cold hells.

original: autpa la dang / padmo dang / ku mu ta dang; punda r'i ga'i sems can dmyal ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: autpa la dang / padmo dang / ku mu ta dang; punda r'i ga'i sems can dmyal ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The hells of Utpala, Padma, Kumuda, and Puṇḍarīka are like this.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba na sdug bsngal myong ba na lus kyi sha kun kham tshad kham tshad du yos rngo ba ltar chad cing gas nas mgo dang rus pa yang dum bu brgya stong du chad cing gas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba na sdug bsngal myong ba na lus kyi sha kun kham tshad kham tshad du yos rngo ba ltar chad cing gas nas mgo dang rus pa yang dum bu brgya stong du chad cing gas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the beings in the cold hells experience suffering, their flesh is torn off in pieces, and their heads and bones are split into a hundred thousand fragments, like a dried fish torn to pieces or split open.

original: sems can gang ser sna byed cing gzhan gyi 'tsho ba bcad de ltogs su bor ba dang / kha zas dus bzhin du mi ster na /
analyzed: sems can gang ser sna byed cing gzhan gyi 'tsho ba bcad de ltogs su bor ba dang / kha zas dus bzhin du mi ster na /
translated: Those sentient beings who are stingy, who deprive others of their livelihood and let them starve, and who do not give food at the proper time,

original: yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ste /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ste /
translated: fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: mi de kha zas mi chud cing skyug dro ba'i nad kyis btab na /
analyzed: mi de kha zas mi chud cing skyug dro ba'i nad kyis btab na /
translated: When those people are unable to swallow food and are afflicted with vomiting and indigestion,

original: nang g-yog gam bshes gnyen gyi kha zas rnam pa mang po dang sbyar te 'di ni /
analyzed: nang g-yog gam bshes gnyen gyi kha zas rnam pa mang po dang sbyar te 'di ni /
translated: their relatives and friends prepare many kinds of food and drink, saying,

original: mngar ro // 'di ni /
analyzed: mngar ro // 'di ni /
translated: “This is sweet.

original: skyur ro // 'di ni /
analyzed: skyur ro // 'di ni /
translated: This is sour.

original: bsod pa'o // 'di ni /
analyzed: bsod pa'o // 'di ni /
translated: This is delicious.

original: 'ju sla ba'o //
analyzed: 'ju sla ba'o //
translated: This is easy to digest.

original: zhes nan tan gyis bstabs na; nad pa de khros te bdag kha zas 'di mig gis mi mthong ba'i dus yod dam snyam bsam nas de tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ngo //
analyzed: zhes nan tan gyis bstabs na; nad pa de khros te bdag kha zas 'di mig gis mi mthong ba'i dus yod dam snyam bsam nas de tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ngo //
translated: If the patient is insistent, the sick person will become angry and think, “When will the time come that I will not even see this food with my eyes?” As soon as he dies, he will fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: sems can gang glen pa gti mug can /
analyzed: sems can gang glen pa gti mug can /
translated: “ Sentient beings who are foolish and confused,

original: dkon mchog gsum la ma dad pa /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la ma dad pa /
translated: who have no faith in the Three Jewels,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni /
translated: and who slander the noble ones

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ste /
translated: will be born in the animal realm.

original: de yang nad kyis @290b gzir pa na sgur te nyal ni /
analyzed: de yang nad kyis @290b gzir pa na sgur te nyal ni /
translated: “ When they are afflicted by illness, they will lie down bent over,

original: shes kyi / 'phres te nyal mi shes la /
analyzed: shes kyi / 'phres te nyal mi shes la /
translated: unable to lie down stretched out.

original: dge ba'i phyogs gtam snyan pa thos mi 'dod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs gtam snyan pa thos mi 'dod na /
translated: If they do not wish to hear about virtuous things,

analyzed: nad g-yog gis kyang gdon mi za bar tshe 'pho bar shes pas na / nad g-yog gis kyang khyod chos nyon cig /
translated: the nurse should understand that the patient will certainly die.

original: tshul khrims kyang nos shig /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang nos shig /
translated: “ The nurse should exhort the patient, ‘Listen to the Dharma!🔽Take up moral discipline!

original: sku gzugs dang dge slong dag kyang mthong bar byos la /
analyzed: sku gzugs dang dge slong dag kyang mthong bar byos la /
translated: See images and monks!

original: de la sbyin pa yang byos shig ces bskul na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa yang byos shig ces bskul na /
translated: Make offerings to them!’

original: de la mi dad mi dga' ste /
analyzed: de la mi dad mi dga' ste /
translated: He had no faith in them and did not like them.

original: nan gyis bskul ma btab pa dang / de khros nas bdag dkon mchog gsum dang / dge ba'i ming yang mi thos pa zhig tu song na ci ma rung zhes smras nas tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye'o //
analyzed: nan gyis bskul ma btab pa dang / de khros nas bdag dkon mchog gsum dang / dge ba'i ming yang mi thos pa zhig tu song na ci ma rung zhes smras nas tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye'o //
translated: When he was urged to do so, he became angry and said, “How nice it would be if I were to go somewhere where I would not hear the names of the Three Jewels or of virtue!” As soon as he had said this, he died and was immediately reborn in the animal realm.

original: de la gad lha dang mi'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa de ni /
analyzed: de la gad lha dang mi'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa de ni /
translated: The gods and humans who are diligent in virtue, which is the cause of being a god or human,

original: nad kyis kyang shin tu gdungs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nad kyis kyang shin tu gdungs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not afflicted by illness.

original: tshe'i dus byed pa na sems kyang mi 'khrug gi /
analyzed: tshe'i dus byed pa na sems kyang mi 'khrug gi /
translated: When they die, their minds are not disturbed.

original: nad g-yog dang bshes gnyen dag gis 'chi bar rtogs nas khyod dam pa'i chos thos par 'dod dam /
analyzed: nad g-yog dang bshes gnyen dag gis 'chi bar rtogs nas khyod dam pa'i chos thos par 'dod dam /
translated: When their nurses and friends realize that they are dying, they ask, “Do you want to hear the holy Dharma?

original: sku gzugs mthong bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: sku gzugs mthong bar 'dod dam /
translated: Do you want to see an image?

original: dge slong dag las mdo sde dang tshigs su bcad pa dag nyan par 'dod dam /
analyzed: dge slong dag las mdo sde dang tshigs su bcad pa dag nyan par 'dod dam /
translated: Do you want to hear a sūtra or verses from a monk?

original: khyod tshul khrims mnod par dga'am /
analyzed: khyod tshul khrims mnod par dga'am /
translated: Do you want to take up the precepts?

original: sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la longs spyod 'bul par dad dam zhes bskul na /🔽de dag kun la dad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la longs spyod 'bul par dad dam zhes bskul na / de dag kun la dad do //
translated: If you ask them if they have faith in offering wealth to the Buddha and the Saṅgha,

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: they will all say, ‘I have faith.’

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la yon phul na @291a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la yon phul na @291a *//
translated: Moreover, if you offer wealth to an image of the Buddha,

original: tshangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: you will become a buddha.

original: chos la mchod cing longs spyod phul na /
analyzed: chos la mchod cing longs spyod phul na /
translated: If you make offerings to the Dharma and offer wealth,

original: gang nas gang du skye ba'i gnas thams cad du shes pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang nas gang du skye ba'i gnas thams cad du shes pa dang ldan te /
translated: you will be endowed with knowledge in all the places where you are born.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will understand and realize the characteristics of the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun la longs spyod kyi sbyin pa byas na /
analyzed: dge 'dun la longs spyod kyi sbyin pa byas na /
translated: If you make an offering of wealth to the Saṅgha,

original: gang nas gang du skyes kyang rin po che dang / longs spyod chen po dang yid bzhin du ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang nas gang du skyes kyang rin po che dang / longs spyod chen po dang yid bzhin du ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: you will be endowed with jewels and great wealth wherever you are born, just as you wish.

original: zhes nad pa la gtam byas na /
analyzed: zhes nad pa la gtam byas na /
translated: If you speak in this way to the sick,

original: nad pa rab tu dga' mgu rangs te bdag skye ba thams cad du dkon mchog gsum dang phrad cing chos thos pa dang / chos thos nas khyad khong du chud cing rtogs par gyur cig ces smon lam btab na tshe'i dus byed de mi'i nang du skye'o //
analyzed: nad pa rab tu dga' mgu rangs te bdag skye ba thams cad du dkon mchog gsum dang phrad cing chos thos pa dang / chos thos nas khyad khong du chud cing rtogs par gyur cig ces smon lam btab na tshe'i dus byed de mi'i nang du skye'o //
translated: The sick person will be overjoyed and will make the following aspiration: “In all my future lives, may I encounter the Three Jewels, hear the Dharma, and, having heard the Dharma, may I understand and realize its significance.” When they die, they will be reborn among humans.

original: gang zhig lhar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs rgya cher bskyed pa /
analyzed: gang zhig lhar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs rgya cher bskyed pa /
translated: Those who have cultivated vast stores of virtue that will lead to rebirth as a god

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa /
translated: and who have pure generosity and discipline,

original: chos nyan par dga' ba /
analyzed: chos nyan par dga' ba /
translated: who delight in listening to the Dharma,

original: dge ba bcu la spyod pa'i gang zag de ni /
analyzed: dge ba bcu la spyod pa'i gang zag de ni /
translated: and who practice the ten virtues

original: dus byed pa na bde bar nyal bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang / lha'i pho brang dang / lha'i bu mo dag mthong zhing lha'i rol mo dag thos te mdangs kyang shin tu bzang ba dang / lag pa gyen du 'degs pa ni; tshe'i dus byas nas mtho ris lha'i nang du skye'o //
analyzed: dus byed pa na bde bar nyal bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang / lha'i pho brang dang / lha'i bu mo dag mthong zhing lha'i rol mo dag thos te mdangs kyang shin tu bzang ba dang / lag pa gyen du 'degs pa ni; tshe'i dus byas nas mtho ris lha'i nang du skye'o //
translated: will, when they die, see images of the Buddha, divine palaces, and divine maidens, hear the music of the gods, and feel extremely good. When they raise their arms upward, they will die and be reborn among the gods in the higher realms.

original: khyim bdag sar phag gis chung ma de bdag gi lus la chags pas /
analyzed: khyim bdag sar phag gis chung ma de bdag gi lus la chags pas /
translated: The householder Śarabhaṅga’s wife was attached to his body.

original: tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu phyir yang bud med @291b gyi lus de la sbrul du skyes te /
analyzed: tshe'i dus byas ma thag tu phyir yang bud med @291b gyi lus de la sbrul du skyes te /
translated: As soon as she died, she was reborn as a snake in that very woman’s body.

original: sbrul de las tshe'i dus byas nas sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul de las tshe'i dus byas nas sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the snake died, she experienced the immeasurable suffering of the great hells.

original: dge slong des yang slob dpon la gsol pa /
analyzed: dge slong des yang slob dpon la gsol pa /
translated: The monk asked his teacher,

original: bdag gi sha la za ba'i bud med de su lags /
analyzed: bdag gi sha la za ba'i bud med de su lags /
translated: “Who was the woman who ate my flesh?”

original: moo gal gyi bus smras pa /
analyzed: moo gal gyi bus smras pa /
translated: Maudgalyāyana said,

original: mnyan du yod pa na dge bsnyen ma zhig la bran mo zhig yod do //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na dge bsnyen ma zhig la bran mo zhig yod do //

analyzed: zhes brjod pa dang / chu srin gyis sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //

translated: “The earth of the great earth is much more.

analyzed: sen mo'i steng gi sa mang ba ma lags so //
translated: The earth on the palm of your hand is not more.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ngas btul ba'i sems can ni /
analyzed: ngas btul ba'i sems can ni /
translated: “The beings I have guided

original: sen mo'i steng gis dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sen mo'i steng gis dang 'dra'o //
translated: are like the earth on the palm of my hand.

original: gang ma btul ba ni /
analyzed: gang ma btul ba ni /
translated: Those I have not guided

original: sa chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sa chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: are like the great earth.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud sdig to can la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud sdig to can la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the evil Māra,

original: da ste zla ba gsum nang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'o //
analyzed: da ste zla ba gsum nang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'o //
translated: “In three months from now, I will pass into parinirvāṇa.”

original: zhes bka' stsal pa bdud sdig to can gyis thos @320b nas rab tu dga' mgu rangs te phyir dong ngo //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa bdud sdig to can gyis thos @320b nas rab tu dga' mgu rangs te phyir dong ngo //
translated: When the evil Māra heard this, he was overjoyed and left.

original: de'i tshe kun dga' bo tshal gyi nang na gnyid log nas rmi lam du shing chen po nam mkha'i khams kun tu yog pa la yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu shin tu rgyas pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun dga' bo tshal gyi nang na gnyid log nas rmi lam du shing chen po nam mkha'i khams kun tu yog pa la yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu shin tu rgyas pa /
translated: At that time, Ānanda was sleeping in the forest. In his dream, he saw a great tree filling the entire realm of space, with abundant branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits,

original: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba /
translated: benefiting all beings.

original: shing de la yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhig rmis te /
analyzed: shing de la yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhig rmis te /
translated: That tree had various inconceivable qualities.

original: ring po ma lon par rlung chen po langs nas yal ga dang lo ma kun grugs te rdul bzhin du 'thor nas kyang stobs po che'i gnas su med par gyur te 'gro ba thams cad shin tu mya ngan byed pa snyam rmis nas sad pa dang mi bde
analyzed: ring po ma lon par rlung chen po langs nas yal ga dang lo ma kun grugs te rdul bzhin du 'thor nas kyang stobs po che'i gnas su med par gyur te 'gro ba thams cad shin tu mya ngan byed pa snyam rmis nas sad pa dang mi bde
translated: The great tree was no more, and all beings were plunged into deep sorrow.

original: zhing skrag par gyur te 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: zhing skrag par gyur te 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: When he awoke, he was unhappy and frightened. He thought,

original: bdag gis lha dang mi thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i shing chen po yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa zhig rmis nas ring po ma lon par rlung chen pos gtor te med par byas pa 'di /
analyzed: bdag gis lha dang mi thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i shing chen po yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa zhig rmis nas ring po ma lon par rlung chen pos gtor te med par byas pa 'di /
translated: “I dreamed of a great tree that possessed all good qualities and would have benefited all gods and humans. Before long, a great wind blew it away and destroyed it.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: The Blessed One

original: shing chen po dang 'dra bar thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur na /
analyzed: shing chen po dang 'dra bar thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur na /
translated: is like a great tree that is the refuge of all.

original: ci bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' bar mi dgongs sam snyam bsams nas shin tu skrag ste bcom ldan 'das gang na bar 'ongs nas zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' bar mi dgongs sam snyam bsams nas shin tu skrag ste bcom ldan 'das gang na bar 'ongs nas zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He was so frightened that he went to where the Buddha was, bowed at his feet, and said to the Buddha:

original: bdag tshal na mchis pa las rmi lam 'di lta bu zhig rmis na /🔽ci bcom ldan 'das mya @321a *//
analyzed: bdag tshal na mchis pa las rmi lam 'di lta bu zhig rmis na / ci bcom ldan 'das mya @321a *//
translated: “I was in the forest and had this kind of dream:

original: ngan las 'da' bar mi dgongs sam /
analyzed: ngan las 'da' bar mi dgongs sam /
translated: Does the World-Honored One not intend to enter nirvana?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to Ānanda:

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: “It is so, it is so.

original: khyod kyis smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: nga da ste zla ba gsum na mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: nga da ste zla ba gsum na mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: In three months I will enter nirvana.

original: gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob pa ni /
analyzed: gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob pa ni /
translated: Those who have attained the four bases of supernatural power

original: bskal pa gcig gi bar du gnas te /
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gi bar du gnas te /
translated: can live for one eon.

original: nga yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shin tu bsgoms na; de de bzhin gshegs pa sku tshe ji srid kyi bar bzhugs pa'i rigs zhes khyod la dris na /
analyzed: nga yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shin tu bsgoms na; de de bzhin gshegs pa sku tshe ji srid kyi bar bzhugs pa'i rigs zhes khyod la dris na /
translated: If I, having well cultivated the four bases of supernatural power, were to remain for an eon or for the remainder of the Tathāgata’s life, if you asked me,

original: lan gsum gyi bar du dris kyang khyod smrar ma btub ste /
analyzed: lan gsum gyi bar du dris kyang khyod smrar ma btub ste /
translated: He asked this three times, but you did not speak.

original: khyod song ba'i 'og tu bdud kyi rgyal po sdig to can 'ongs te mya ngan las 'da' bar gsol nas ngas kyang de bzhin du gnang ngo //
analyzed: khyod song ba'i 'og tu bdud kyi rgyal po sdig to can 'ongs te mya ngan las 'da' bar gsol nas ngas kyang de bzhin du gnang ngo //
translated: After you had left, the evil Mara came and asked me to enter Nirvana, and I agreed to do so.

original: kun dga' bos de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas rab tu mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs te lus mi bzod par gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bos de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas rab tu mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs te lus mi bzod par gyur te /
translated: Ananda, hearing this, was greatly distressed and overcome with grief.

original: nye gnas rnams kyis gcig la gcig spran nas thams cad kyang mya ngan gyis gdugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der lhags so //
analyzed: nye gnas rnams kyis gcig la gcig spran nas thams cad kyang mya ngan gyis gdugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der lhags so //
translated: The disciples, alarmed, came to him and all together they went to the Buddha.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo dang nye gnas rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo dang nye gnas rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to Ananda and the disciples,

original: rtag ces bya ba su yin /
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba su yin /
translated: Who is it that says, Forever?

original: thams cad la rtag pa med de /
analyzed: thams cad la rtag pa med de /
translated: There is nothing that is forever.

original: khyod kyi phyir bya ba kun mdzad de /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyir bya ba kun mdzad de /
translated: I have done everything for you.🔽 Now I am going to enter Nirvana.

original: bstan pa yang bstan zin pas khyed rnams mya ngan ma byed par brtson 'grus su nan tan gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @321b lus de skad du bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: bstan pa yang bstan zin pas khyed rnams mya ngan ma byed par brtson 'grus su nan tan gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @321b lus de skad du bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: The Dharma has already been taught, so do not grieve. You should diligently practice with perseverance.

original: zhes thos pa dang mya ngan du gyur te /
analyzed: zhes thos pa dang mya ngan du gyur te /
translated: At that time, the Venerable Śāriputra heard that the Blessed One was passing into nirvāṇa, and he became sorrowful.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba ni ha cang yang myur ches so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba ni ha cang yang myur ches so //
translated: The Tathāgata's passing into nirvāṇa is far too soon!

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad mdongs shing mgon med par gyur to //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad mdongs shing mgon med par gyur to //
translated: The entire world, including the gods, will be blinded and without a protector.

original: zhes smras te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: zhes smras te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said this and addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bdag ni / bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong bar mi bzod de /
analyzed: bdag ni / bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong bar mi bzod de /
translated: I cannot bear to see the Blessed One passing into nirvāṇa.

original: ci nas kyang bdag sngar mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag sngar mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: I will pass into nirvāṇa first, no matter what.

original: zhes lan gsum gyi bar du gsol to //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum gyi bar du gsol to //
translated: He made this request three times.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: da ste khyod dus la bab par shes pa na /
analyzed: da ste khyod dus la bab par shes pa na /
translated: Now, knowing that your time has come,

original: 'phags pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad ni /
translated: All noble ones

original: zhi bas mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: zhi bas mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: attain nirvana through tranquility.

original: zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus did he speak.

original: sh'a ri'i bus kyang bcom ldan 'das las gnang ba'i lung thob nas gos tshags bcos nas bcom ldan 'das la lan brgya tsam bskor te tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa mang pos bstod nas sangs rgyas kyi zhabs dang phyag nas bzung ste lan gsum gyi bar du spyi
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus kyang bcom ldan 'das las gnang ba'i lung thob nas gos tshags bcos nas bcom ldan 'das la lan brgya tsam bskor te tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa mang pos bstod nas sangs rgyas kyi zhabs dang phyag nas bzung ste lan gsum gyi bar du spyi
translated: Śāriputra, having received the prophecy from the Blessed One, adjusted his robe, circumambulated the Blessed One a hundred times, and praised him with many verses. He held the feet and hands of the Buddha and bowed his head to the ground three times.

original: bo sa la gtugs nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad du bdag gis nang gi tha mar yang bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: bo sa la gtugs nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad du bdag gis nang gi tha mar yang bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: With palms joined, he said, I have seen the Blessed One for the last time.

original: zhes smras nas sti stang dang bcas nas mchi phyag 'tshal te nye gnas dge tshul kyun te dang rgyal ba'i khab sngon skye ba'i gnas gang na bar song ngo //
analyzed: zhes smras nas sti stang dang bcas nas mchi phyag 'tshal te nye gnas dge tshul kyun te dang rgyal ba'i khab sngon skye ba'i gnas gang na bar song ngo //
translated: Having said this, he paid homage with respect, bowed, and went to where the novice monk Uttara and the city of Rājagṛha were.

original: der phyin pa dang dge tshul kyun te la bsgo ba /
analyzed: der phyin pa dang dge tshul kyun te la bsgo ba /
translated: When he arrived there, he instructed the novice monk Uttara:

original: khyod song la grong khyer dang / grong @322a *//
analyzed: khyod song la grong khyer dang / grong @322a *//
translated: You go to the city and villages

original: rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / blon po'i gnas dang / yon bdag bshes pa'i gnas kun tu song la de dag la nga phyi phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / blon po'i gnas dang / yon bdag bshes pa'i gnas kun tu song la de dag la nga phyi phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Go to the king's palace, to the ministers' houses, to the houses of benefactors and friends, and say to them, I pay homage to you all.

original: zhes bsgo zhig /
analyzed: zhes bsgo zhig /
translated: Go to the villages, towns, cities, the king's palace, the ministers' residences, and the homes of benefactors and friends, and tell them all, I pay homage to you all.

original: de nas dge tshul kyun te slob dpon gyis bsgo ba bzhin du kun tu song nas 'di skad du bdag gi mkhan po sh'a ri'i bu 'dir gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas dge tshul kyun te slob dpon gyis bsgo ba bzhin du kun tu song nas 'di skad du bdag gi mkhan po sh'a ri'i bu 'dir gshegs te /
translated: Then say, My preceptor Shariputra has come here.

original: mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs kyi /
translated: He is about to enter nirvana.

original: khyed kyis mthong bar 'dod na kun shog cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis mthong bar 'dod na kun shog cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: If you wish to see him, all come together.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / khyim bdag rigs che zhing mtho ba dang / yon bdag gi rigs rnams dge tshul gyis bsgo ba thos nas thams cad mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs par gyur te thams cad tshig mthun par 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / khyim bdag rigs che zhing mtho ba dang / yon bdag gi rigs rnams dge tshul gyis bsgo ba thos nas thams cad mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs par gyur te thams cad tshig mthun par 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: At that time, when King Ajatashatru, the great and noble householders, and the benefactors heard the novice's announcement, they all became unhappy and distressed. They all spoke in unison, saying:

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi gtso bo chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi gtso bo chen po /
translated: Venerable Shariputra, great leader of the Dharma,

original: 'gro ba mang po'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa da mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa da mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: He has become the spiritual friend of many beings.🔽

original: ha cang yang snga ches so //🔽zhes smras nas de dag myur bar sh'a ri'i bu gang na ba der lhags te phyag byas nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ha cang yang snga ches so // zhes smras nas de dag myur bar sh'a ri'i bu gang na ba der lhags te phyag byas nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He has become a spiritual friend to many beings. It is far too soon for him to pass into nirvana.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi gtso bo chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi gtso bo chen po /
translated: ” With these words, they quickly went to where Shariputra was and, after bowing to him, said, “Venerable Shariputra, great leader of the Dharma,

original: 'gro ba mang po'i bshes gnyen sku tshe yongs su gtong ste mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po'i bshes gnyen sku tshe yongs su gtong ste mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: you are giving up your life and passing into nirvana.

original: zhes bdag cag la sogs pa 'gro ba mang po'i mgon dang dpung gnyen med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bdag cag la sogs pa 'gro ba mang po'i mgon dang dpung gnyen med par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that many beings, including ourselves, will be without a protector or refuge.

original: de nas sh'a ri'i bus 'khor mang po la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas sh'a ri'i bus 'khor mang po la smras pa /
translated: ” Then Shariputra said to the large gathering, “

original: thams @322b cad mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: thams @322b cad mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Everything is impermanent.

original: skye ba yang mthar 'chi la 'dus pa yang mthar 'bral bas /
analyzed: skye ba yang mthar 'chi la 'dus pa yang mthar 'bral bas /
translated: What is born will eventually die, and what comes together will eventually separate.

original: khams gsum ni /
analyzed: khams gsum ni /
translated: The three realms

original: sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pas na gang zhig bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pas na gang zhig bde bar 'gyur /
translated: are filled with suffering. Who could be happy?

original: khyed ni / sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las sangs rgyas 'jig rten du gshegs pa dang yang phrad mod kyi /
analyzed: khyed ni / sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las sangs rgyas 'jig rten du gshegs pa dang yang phrad mod kyi /
translated: You have met with the Buddha’s appearance in the world through the roots of virtue from the past.

original: mdo sde dang chos thos pa yang shin tu dka'/
analyzed: mdo sde dang chos thos pa yang shin tu dka'/
translated: It is very difficult to hear the sutras and the Dharma.

original: mi lus thob pa yang shin tu dka' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mi lus thob pa yang shin tu dka' ba yin gyi /
translated: It is very difficult to obtain a human body.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur zhing 'khor ba las grol ba'i las la brtson par gyis shig ces thabs mkhas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor mang po la ji ltar na ba la sman gtong ba bzhin du rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur zhing 'khor ba las grol ba'i las la brtson par gyis shig ces thabs mkhas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor mang po la ji ltar na ba la sman gtong ba bzhin du rgya cher bstan te /
translated: You should strive in the deeds that will become the accumulation of merit and be liberated from saṃsāra.”

original: 'khor mang pos chos bstan pa thos nas kha cig ni /
analyzed: 'khor mang pos chos bstan pa thos nas kha cig ni /
translated: Having heard the Dharma teaching, some in the great assembly

original: 'bras bu dang po nas 'bras bu gsum pa'i bar du thob par gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po nas 'bras bu gsum pa'i bar du thob par gyur /
translated: attained the first fruit up to the third fruit.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some

original: rab tu byung nas dgra bcom par gyur /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas dgra bcom par gyur /
translated: went forth and became arhats.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some🔽vowed to accomplish pratyekabuddhahood.

original: rang sangs rgyas su grub par yi dam bcas te chos bstan pa thos nas phyag 'tshal nas so sor dong ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su grub par yi dam bcas te chos bstan pa thos nas phyag 'tshal nas so sor dong ngo //
translated: Having heard the Dharma teaching, they bowed and went their separate ways.

original: de nas sh'a ri'i bu de'i nub mo nam gyi cha smad la lus dang sems drang por bzhag ste sems rtse gcig tu bsam gtan dang po la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas sh'a ri'i bu de'i nub mo nam gyi cha smad la lus dang sems drang por bzhag ste sems rtse gcig tu bsam gtan dang po la zhugs so //
translated: Then, Shariputra, in the latter part of the night, with body and mind upright, he entered the first meditation with single-minded concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po las byung nas bsam gtan gnyis la zhugs; bsam gtan gnyis pa las byung nas bsam gtan gsum pa la zhugs /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las byung nas bsam gtan gnyis la zhugs; bsam gtan gnyis pa las byung nas bsam gtan gsum pa la zhugs /
translated: Emerging from the first meditation, he entered the second meditation; emerging from the second meditation, he entered the third meditation;

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las byung nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la !zhugs /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las byung nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la !zhugs /
translated: emerging from the third meditation, he entered the fourth meditation.

original: bsam @323a *// gtan bzhi pa las byung nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
analyzed: bsam @323a *// gtan bzhi pa las byung nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
translated: Emerging from the fourth meditation, he entered the concentration of the sphere of infinite space;🔽emerging from the concentration of the sphere of infinite space, he entered the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness;

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
translated: emerging from the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness, he entered the concentration of the sphere of nothingness;

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
translated: He emerged from the samadhi of the sphere of nothingness and entered the samadhi of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin las byung nas 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs /
translated: He emerged from the samadhi of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and entered the samadhi of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung nas mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung nas mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhugs so //
translated: He emerged from the samadhi of cessation and remained in nirvana.

analyzed: de'i tshen brgya byin lha'i dbang pos sh'a ri'i bu mya ngan las 'da' bar shes nas lha'i 'khor brgya stong mang po dang so so nas me tog dang spos la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad thogs te phyogs der lhags nas steng gi nam mkha' la bar mtshams
translated: At that time, Indra, lord of the gods, knowing that Shariputra was entering nirvana, together with many hundreds of thousands of celestial retinues, each holding offering articles such as flowers and incense, arrived at that place and stood in the sky above without any gaps.

translated: They all brought fragrant oil, fragrant incense, flowers, and offerings, and came to pay their respects. Their bodies were overwhelmed by grief and sorrow. They made offerings with the things they had brought.

translated: Indra, Lord of the Gods, ordered the yakshas, You take the gośīrṣa sandalwood from the seashore. The yakshas took the sandalwood from the seashore, piled it up, placed the child on top of it, sprinkled it with ghee and sesame oil, and set it on fire.

analyzed: ngo // 'khor de dag kun gyis phyag 'tshal te phyir dong ngo //

translated: the alms bowl, and the three robes of the master and went to where the Buddha was. He bowed his head to the Buddha’s feet, knelt on the ground, and said, “My master has entered nirvāṇa.🔽These are his relics, his Dharma robes, and his alms bowl.”

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mya ngan las 'das kyang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa dang / chos kyi sku ni /
translated: Śāriputra, even though I have entered nirvāṇa, my morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the insight of liberation, and my Dharma body,

analyzed: mya ngan las ma 'das so //
translated: have not entered nirvāṇa.

translated: “In the world, those who are powerful and great are honored by all.” No sooner had he thought this than he attained the supreme enjoyments of the five desires, just as he wished.

analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu mchog thob pa yang sngon bsod nams kyi tshogs bskyed pa las gyur te /
translated: Thus, attaining the supreme fruit is due to having previously generated the accumulation of merit.

analyzed: dper na / zhing pa dag kyang dpyid sa bon mang du btab na /

analyzed: ston mang du bsdur yod do snyam du re ba yod do //

translated: Now, in order to give to everyone with my jewels and wealth, I will pile it up at the city gates and in the marketplaces and give to sentient beings whatever they desire, all that I possess.

analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed yod pa la yang bang mdzod ci @325b yod pa thams cad 'gro ba mang po la sbyin par bkar btags so //

translated: At that time, all the ascetics and brahmans, the poor, the helpless, the aged, and those who were busy with their affairs gathered like clouds.

original: gang gos 'dod pa la gos /
analyzed: gang gos 'dod pa la gos /
translated: To those who wanted clothes, he gave clothes.

original: zas 'dod pa la zas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la zas /
translated: To those who wanted food, he gave food.

original: gser dngul dang nor rin po che 'dod pa la gser dngul dang nor bu rin po che /
analyzed: gser dngul dang nor rin po che 'dod pa la gser dngul dang nor bu rin po che /
translated: To those who wanted gold, silver, and precious jewels, he gave gold, silver, and precious jewels.

original: nad pa rnams la ni nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs te /
analyzed: nad pa rnams la ni nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs te /
translated: To the sick, he gave the conditions for healing, such as medicine.

original: ci bdog pa yid bzhin du byin no //
analyzed: ci bdog pa yid bzhin du byin no //
translated: He gave away all that he had, just as they wished.

original: de'i tshe na 'dzam bu gling na 'khod pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyal po'i drin gyis thams cad bde zhing skyid pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'dzam bu gling na 'khod pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyal po'i drin gyis thams cad bde zhing skyid pas /
translated: At that time, through the kindness of the king, all the beings living in the world were happy and prosperous.

analyzed: glu len bro brdung tshigs su bcad pas bstod do //
translated: They sang songs, danced, and praised him in verse.

analyzed: rgyal po de'i ming snyan pa mtha' 'og kun tu grags nas bka' mi nyan pa med do //
translated: The king's good name was renowned in all the lands, and there was no one who did not obey his orders.

analyzed: de'i tshe na yul gyi mtha' 'khob na rgyal po chung du byi ma se na zhes bya ba zhig rgyal po zla 'od la phrag dog skyes nas bde bar nyal du med de gnyid kyang mi bro nas 'di snyam du bsams so //
