analyzed: da ste zhag bdun na rgyal po zla 'od bram ze la dbu'i sbyin pa mdzad kyi /
translated: “Seven days from now King Candraprabha will give the gift of his head to a brahman.

original: mthong bar 'dod pa thams cad myur du shog cig /
analyzed: mthong bar 'dod pa thams cad myur du shog cig /
translated: All who wish to see this should come quickly.”

original: de'i tshe na rgyal phran brgyad khri snyed po de thams cad de ma thag tu lhags te rgyal po'i spyan sngar 'ongs nas lto ba sa la phab ste 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal phran brgyad khri snyed po de thams cad de ma thag tu lhags te rgyal po'i spyan sngar 'ongs nas lto ba sa la phab ste 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time all eighty-four thousand vassal kings immediately arrived and came into the king’s presence. They fell to the ground and said,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad ni /
translated: “All the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa

original: rgyal po'i bka' drin gyis thams cad bde skyid de gnod pa ma mchis ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bka' drin gyis thams cad bde skyid de gnod pa ma mchis ni /
translated: are happy and well through the kindness of the king.

original: mi gcig gi slad du 'gro ba thams cad yongs su spang par mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: mi gcig gi slad du 'gro ba thams cad yongs su spang par mi rigs kyi /
translated: It is not right to abandon all beings for the sake of one man.

original: bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol /
translated: Please do not give away your head out of love for us.”

original: blon po chen po stong phrag bcus kyang lto bas la phab ste bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol /🔽btsun mo stong phrag nyi shus kyang lus sa la phab nas rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: blon po chen po stong phrag bcus kyang lto bas la phab ste bdag cag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol / btsun mo stong phrag nyi shus kyang lus sa la phab nas rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The ten thousand great ministers also fell on their knees and begged, Please have mercy on us and do not give away your head.

original: bdag cag la yang thugs brtse bar dgongs te dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol zhes smras so //
analyzed: bdag cag la yang thugs brtse bar dgongs te dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad par gsol zhes smras so //
translated: The twenty thousand queens also fell on the ground and begged the king, saying, Please have mercy on us and do not give away your head.

original: rgyal bu lnga brgya rnams kyang dus nas bdag cag la mgon dang skyabs ma mchis na /
analyzed: rgyal bu lnga brgya rnams kyang dus nas bdag cag la mgon dang skyabs ma mchis na /
translated: The five hundred princes also wept and said, We have no protector or refuge.

original: thugs brtse bar dgongs te dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad cing bdag kyang mi rjes slebs par bskyed par gsol zhes smras so //🔽de nas rgyal po chen pos blon po dang / btsun mo dang / sras rnams la 'di @329a *//
analyzed: thugs brtse bar dgongs te dbu'i sbyin pa mi mdzad cing bdag kyang mi rjes slebs par bskyed par gsol zhes smras so // de nas rgyal po chen pos blon po dang / btsun mo dang / sras rnams la 'di @329a *//
translated: Please have mercy and do not give away your head. Please do not abandon us.

original: skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the great king said to the ministers, queens, and princes, You should not act in this way.🔽You should not be like this.

original: thog ma med pa nas lus 'di 'khor ba na 'khor zhing yun ring por sems can dmyal ba na 'dug pa'i tshe nyi ma gcig la yang lan du ma zhig tshe 'phos nas lus 'di chud zos te thal chu dang / lcags kyi khri dang /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas lus 'di 'khor ba na 'khor zhing yun ring por sems can dmyal ba na 'dug pa'i tshe nyi ma gcig la yang lan du ma zhig tshe 'phos nas lus 'di chud zos te thal chu dang / lcags kyi khri dang /
translated: Since beginningless time, this body has been wandering in cyclic existence. When you have been in the hells for a long time, you die and are reborn many times in a single day. This body is wasted away, and you experience suffering for a long time in the hells, such as the Hell of Ashes, the Hell of Iron Spikes,

original: chu tshan khol ma dang / ngan skyug dang / me'i shing rta dang / me dong la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal bar yun ring por sdug bsngal myong ste btso ba dang / bsreg pa la sogs pas lus 'di grangs med par chud zos kyang bsod nams 'ga' tsam yang med do //
analyzed: chu tshan khol ma dang / ngan skyug dang / me'i shing rta dang / me dong la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal bar yun ring por sdug bsngal myong ste btso ba dang / bsreg pa la sogs pas lus 'di grangs med par chud zos kyang bsod nams 'ga' tsam yang med do //
translated: the Hell of Boiling Excrement, the Hell of the Fiery Wagon, and the Hell of the Pit of Embers, being boiled, burned, and so forth. This body is wasted away countless times, but not a bit of merit has come of it.

original: gal te dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa na gcig la gcig 'cha' zhing za ba dang / gzhan gyis bsad de kun gyis zos pa dang / tshe 'phos nas rul zhing myags pa yang grags med de /
analyzed: gal te dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa na gcig la gcig 'cha' zhing za ba dang / gzhan gyis bsad de kun gyis zos pa dang / tshe 'phos nas rul zhing myags pa yang grags med de /
translated: If you are born in the animal realm, you are eaten by others, and when you die, you rot and decompose.

original: de ltar lus 'di chud zos kyang bsod nams su gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar lus 'di chud zos kyang bsod nams su gyur pa med do //
translated: This body is wasted away, but not a bit of merit has come of it.

original: yi dvags kyi khams su skyes pa na lus la me 'bar te 'khor los mgo bcad ma thag tu phyir yang sos pa grangs med pa zhig myong ste; de ltar lus chud zos kyang bsod nams su gyur pa med do //
analyzed: yi dvags kyi khams su skyes pa na lus la me 'bar te 'khor los mgo bcad ma thag tu phyir yang sos pa grangs med pa zhig myong ste; de ltar lus chud zos kyang bsod nams su gyur pa med do //
translated: If he is born in the realm of hungry ghosts, his body will be ablaze with fire, and he will experience countless times the cutting off of his head with a wheel, only to have it grow again.

original: gal te mir skyes pa na yang nor dang / bud med kyi phyir khros rngams pas mig bgrad de gcig la gcig 'tshe zhing gsod pa dang / g-yul ngor lhags nas gcig la gcig gsod de /
analyzed: gal te mir skyes pa na yang nor dang / bud med kyi phyir khros rngams pas mig bgrad de gcig la gcig 'tshe zhing gsod pa dang / g-yul ngor lhags nas gcig la gcig gsod de /
translated: Even if he is born as a human being, he will be angry and fierce, his eyes red, harming and killing others, and he will go to war and kill others.

original: de ltar lus chud zos pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi lus grangs med pa @329b zhig bor yang bsod nams su ma gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar lus chud zos pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi lus grangs med pa @329b zhig bor yang bsod nams su ma gyur te /
translated: In this way, his body will be wasted, and he will cast off countless bodies of desire, hatred, and ignorance, but it will not be for the sake of merit.

original: bdag gi lus 'di yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: I will give up this body of mine.

original: bdag gi lus 'di ni /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di ni /
translated: This body of mine

original: mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phung po ste /
translated: is a mass of various impurities,

original: ring po mi thogs par 'jig cing 'bral bar 'gyur bar /
analyzed: ring po mi thogs par 'jig cing 'bral bar 'gyur bar /
translated: which will soon be destroyed and separated.

original: mi brtan zhing btsog pa'i mgo 'dis phan pa'i don chen por 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi brtan zhing btsog pa'i mgo 'dis phan pa'i don chen por 'gyur na /
translated: If this unstable, filthy head can be of great benefit,

original: ci'i phyir sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin par mi bya /
translated: why should I not give it?

original: nga'i mgo bo 'di bram ze de la byin te /
analyzed: nga'i mgo bo 'di bram ze de la byin te /
translated: I will give this head of mine to that brahman.

original: bsod nams des bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub bo //
analyzed: bsod nams des bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub bo //
translated: By this merit I will accomplish unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nam mngon par sangs rgyas na yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mngon par sangs rgyas na yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When I am fully enlightened, I will have perfect qualities.

original: thabs la mkhas pas khyed kyang sdug bsngal las bzla'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas khyed kyang sdug bsngal las bzla'o //
translated: With skillful means I will deliver you from suffering.

original: ngas sbyin pa byas pa 'dis mngon par 'tshang rgya yi /
analyzed: ngas sbyin pa byas pa 'dis mngon par 'tshang rgya yi /
translated: By this giving of mine I will become fully enlightened.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la khyed bar chad dang bgegs ma byed cig /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la khyed bar chad dang bgegs ma byed cig /
translated: Do not create obstacles or hindrances to the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment.

original: rgyal phran dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / sras rnams de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
analyzed: rgyal phran dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / sras rnams de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
translated: When the vassal kings, ministers, queen, and princes heard these words, they sat there in silence.

original: de nas rgyal po chen pos bram ze de la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen pos bram ze de la smras pa /
translated: Then the great king said to the brahman,

original: da mgo bo bslang ba'i dus la bab kyi /
analyzed: da mgo bo bslang ba'i dus la bab kyi /
translated: “Now the time has come to take the head.

original: longs shig ces smras so //
analyzed: longs shig ces smras so //
translated: Take it away.”

original: bram zes gsol pa; da ltar rgyal pos blon po la sogs pa 'khor mang pos bskor te bdag gcig pus rgyal po'i dbu gcad pa'i mthu ma mchis te /
analyzed: bram zes gsol pa; da ltar rgyal pos blon po la sogs pa 'khor mang pos bskor te bdag gcig pus rgyal po'i dbu gcad pa'i mthu ma mchis te /
translated: The brahman said, “Now, the king is surrounded by many attendants, such as ministers. I alone do not have the power to cut off the king’s head.

original: thugs mi thub bo //
analyzed: thugs mi thub bo //
translated: I cannot do it.

original: bdag la stsal bar chad na /
analyzed: bdag la stsal bar chad na /
translated: If you give me permission,

original: rgyab kyi skyed mos tshal du gshegs so //
analyzed: rgyab kyi skyed mos tshal du gshegs so //
translated: I will go to the garden in the rear.”

original: zhes gsol to //
analyzed: zhes gsol to //
translated: He made this request.

original: de nas rgyal po chen pos rgyal phran dang / rgyal bu rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen pos rgyal phran dang / rgyal bu rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: Then the great king ordered the vassal kings and princes,

original: khyed nga la bsnyen bkur byed na /
analyzed: khyed nga la bsnyen bkur byed na /
translated: “If you serve me,

original: bram ze 'di la gnod @330a *//
analyzed: bram ze 'di la gnod @330a *//
translated: do not harm this brahman.”

original: pa'i kyal ka ma byed cig ces bsgos nas bram ze dang 'grogs te rgyal po skyed mos tshal du song ngo //
analyzed: pa'i kyal ka ma byed cig ces bsgos nas bram ze dang 'grogs te rgyal po skyed mos tshal du song ngo //
translated: Having given this order, he went to the king’s garden accompanied by the brahman.

original: de nas bram ze des rgyal po la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des rgyal po la gsol pa /
translated: Then the brahman said to the king,

original: rgyal po ni /
analyzed: rgyal po ni /
translated: “The king

original: sku gzhon te /
analyzed: sku gzhon te /
translated: is young.

original: ring yang gyad dang mnyam pas na /
analyzed: ring yang gyad dang mnyam pas na /
translated: Even though he is tall, he is equal to a wrestler.

original: tsha ba mi bzod de phyir yang 'gyod kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: tsha ba mi bzod de phyir yang 'gyod kyang srid kyi /
translated: Since he cannot endure heat, he might regret it later.

original: rgyal po'i dbu shing zhig la btags te gdod dgum par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i dbu shing zhig la btags te gdod dgum par 'tshal lo //
translated: I will hang the king’s head on a tree and then kill him.”

original: de nas rgyal po shing yal ga brtan cing lo mas kun tu khebs pa zhig la mgo btags nas pus mo sa la btsugs te bram ze la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po shing yal ga brtan cing lo mas kun tu khebs pa zhig la mgo btags nas pus mo sa la btsugs te bram ze la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the king, his head bowed to a sturdy tree branch covered with leaves, his knees touching the ground, said to the brahman:

original: khyod kyis nga'i mgo chod la phyir yang nga'i lag tu bzhag nas nga'i lag nas longs shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis nga'i mgo chod la phyir yang nga'i lag tu bzhag nas nga'i lag nas longs shig /
translated: “You cut off my head and then put it back on my body. Take it from my hand.

original: ngas khyod la mgo sbyin pa'i bsod nams 'di ni /
analyzed: ngas khyod la mgo sbyin pa'i bsod nams 'di ni /
translated: The merit of my giving you my head

original: bdud dam tshangs pa 'dod pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdud dam tshangs pa 'dod pa ma yin /
translated: is not for the sake of Mara, Brahma,

original: brgya byin nam /
analyzed: brgya byin nam /
translated: Indra,🔽or a universal monarch,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'am; khams gsum gyi bde ba'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'am; khams gsum gyi bde ba'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: or for the enjoyment of the bliss of the three realms.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod de /
translated: It is for the sake of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 'gro ba mang po skyong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po skyong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of protecting many beings and establishing them in the bliss of nirvana.”

original: de'i tshe na bram ze des ral gri phyar te gdab ces byas pa dang / shing gi lha de rab tu mi dga' bar gyur nas ci'i phyir mi 'di gsod pa'i las byed snyam nas bram ze de'i rna drung du thal mo gcig bsnun pas rkang lag ma tshugs te sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bram ze des ral gri phyar te gdab ces byas pa dang / shing gi lha de rab tu mi dga' bar gyur nas ci'i phyir mi 'di gsod pa'i las byed snyam nas bram ze de'i rna drung du thal mo gcig bsnun pas rkang lag ma tshugs te sa la 'gyel to //
translated: At that time the brahman raised his sword and was about to strike when the tree spirit became very unhappy and thought, “Why is this man doing this deed of killing?” He snapped his fingers right next to the brahman’s ear. The brahman’s arms and legs became paralyzed and he fell to the ground.

original: de nas rgyal po des yar shing gi lha la bltas te smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des yar shing gi lha la bltas te smras pa /
translated: Then the king looked up at the tree spirit and said,

original: sngon @330b 'das pa'i dus na shing 'di la mgo bo dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu snyed kyi sbyin pa byas te /
analyzed: sngon @330b 'das pa'i dus na shing 'di la mgo bo dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu snyed kyi sbyin pa byas te /
translated: “In the past, I gave away my head nine hundred and ninety-nine times.

original: da mgo bo 'di sa sbyin ba stong du tshang ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs kyi /
analyzed: da mgo bo 'di sa sbyin ba stong du tshang ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs kyi /
translated: Now, if I give away this head, I will have made a thousand gifts of my head. I will have completed the perfection of generosity.

original: nga'i bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bar chad ma byed cig /
analyzed: nga'i bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bar chad ma byed cig /
translated: Do not create an obstacle to my unsurpassed enlightenment.”

original: de'i tshe na shing gi lha des rgyal pos smras pa thos nas bram ze de phyir sor chud par byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na shing gi lha des rgyal pos smras pa thos nas bram ze de phyir sor chud par byas te /
translated: At that time the tree spirit heard what the king had said. He restored the brahman to health.

original: bram ze de sa las langs nas ral gri thogs te rgyal po'i mgo bcad do //
analyzed: bram ze de sa las langs nas ral gri thogs te rgyal po'i mgo bcad do //
translated: The brahman rose from the ground, took up his sword, and cut off the king's head.

original: mgo lag tu lhung ba na sa chen po yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos /🔽lha'i pho brang yang 'gul zhing ldeg ste mi bde bar gyur nas ngo mtshar ya mtshan du gyur te kun gyis byang chub sems dpas 'gro ba thams cad kyi phyir mgo'i sbyin pa byas par mthong nas thams cad 'dus shing tshogs te ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: mgo lag tu lhung ba na sa chen po yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos / lha'i pho brang yang 'gul zhing ldeg ste mi bde bar gyur nas ngo mtshar ya mtshan du gyur te kun gyis byang chub sems dpas 'gro ba thams cad kyi phyir mgo'i sbyin pa byas par mthong nas thams cad 'dus shing tshogs te ngo mtshar to //
translated: When the head fell to the ground, the great earth shook in six ways.

original: zhes mchi mchar bzhin du phab ste dus nas 'di skad ces smras so /
analyzed: zhes mchi mchar bzhin du phab ste dus nas 'di skad ces smras so /
translated: The palace of the gods shook and trembled, and they became uneasy. They were amazed and all saw the Bodhisattva giving away his head for the sake of all beings. They all gathered together, and with tears streaming down their faces, they lamented and said:

original: rgyal po zla 'od kyis mgo'i sbyin pa byas pas /
analyzed: rgyal po zla 'od kyis mgo'i sbyin pa byas pas /
translated: The king Candraprabha gave away his head.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: By giving away his head, he completed the perfection of generosity.

original: zhes kun tu grags par gyur nas rgyal po byi ma se nas thos nas mi dga' ches te 'khams nas snying gas te che 'phos so //
analyzed: zhes kun tu grags par gyur nas rgyal po byi ma se nas thos nas mi dga' ches te 'khams nas snying gas te che 'phos so //
translated: When this became widely known, King Bimbisāra heard it and became very unhappy. He was distressed, his heart broke, and he died.

original: de'i tshe na bram zes rgyal po'i mgo khyer te song ba'i tshe rgyal phran dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / rgyal bu rnams lus sa la brdabs te cho nges btab nas la la ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bram zes rgyal po'i mgo khyer te song ba'i tshe rgyal phran dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / rgyal bu rnams lus sa la brdabs te cho nges btab nas la la ni /
translated: At that time, when the brahman carried off the king’s head, the vassal kings, ministers, queens, and princes beat their bodies on the ground, wailing.

original: khrag tu skyugs te tshe 'phos so //
analyzed: khrag tu skyugs te tshe 'phos so //
translated: Some vomited blood and died.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some

original: ci yang mi dran par myos so //
analyzed: ci yang mi dran par myos so //
translated: were delirious and did not remember anything.🔽Some

original: kha @331a *// cig ni; rang gi skra kun 'bal to //
analyzed: kha @331a *// cig ni; rang gi skra kun 'bal to //
translated: pulled out all their hair.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some

original: rang gi gos kun dral /
analyzed: rang gi gos kun dral /
translated: tore all their clothes.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some

original: lag pa gnyis kyis rang gi gdong kun drad nas cho nges 'debs shing sa la 'gre'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis rang gi gdong kun drad nas cho nges 'debs shing sa la 'gre'o //
translated: covered their faces with their hands and wailed as they fell to the ground.

original: de'i tshe na bram ze des rgyal po'i dbu mi sdug cing mnam mo //🔽zhes mi 'dod nas sa la bor te song ba dang / de la bram ze kha cig gis khyod ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bram ze des rgyal po'i dbu mi sdug cing mnam mo // zhes mi 'dod nas sa la bor te song ba dang / de la bram ze kha cig gis khyod ni /
translated: At that time, the brahman did not want the king’s head, which was ugly and stank.

original: shin tu gdug pa can yin pa lta /
analyzed: shin tu gdug pa can yin pa lta /
translated: He threw it on the ground and left. Some brahmanas scolded him, saying, “You are extremely evil.

original: thog ma nas dgos pa med na bslangs te ci bya zhes spyos so //
analyzed: thog ma nas dgos pa med na bslangs te ci bya zhes spyos so //
translated: If you had no use for it from the beginning, why did you ask for it?”

original: bram ze de lam du zhugs te song ba las phrad pa thams cad kyis spyos nas kha zas mi ster te shin tu nyam thag par gyur la /
analyzed: bram ze de lam du zhugs te song ba las phrad pa thams cad kyis spyos nas kha zas mi ster te shin tu nyam thag par gyur la /
translated: The brahman set out on the road. Everyone he met along the way scolded him and would not give him any food. He became extremely weak.

original: lam nas rgyal po byi ma se na yang tshe 'phos pa'i gtam thos pas thog mar re ba'i sems ltar ma gyur pas mya ngan gyis yi mug ste snying bdun du gas nas khrag tu skyugs te tshe 'phos so //
analyzed: lam nas rgyal po byi ma se na yang tshe 'phos pa'i gtam thos pas thog mar re ba'i sems ltar ma gyur pas mya ngan gyis yi mug ste snying bdun du gas nas khrag tu skyugs te tshe 'phos so //
translated: On the road, he heard that King Bimbisāra had passed away. His mind was not as hopeful as before, and he was overcome with grief. His heart split into seven pieces, he vomited blood, and he passed away.
